snippet: Facebook has largely managed to avoid being seen as greedy, or potentially dangerous, but that gets complicated when you are sitting on billions of dollars in market value.
abstract: Facebook has largely managed to avoid being seen as greedy, or potentially dangerous, but that gets complicated when you are sitting on billions of dollars in market value.
lead_paragraph: Does Facebook seem a little less cuddly after last week? Sure, the platform is full of your friends, their babies, their cats (or shots of them drinking with or freaking out other people, depending on your demo), but the company's filing for an initial public offering made it clear Facebook is intent commodifying your communications and relationships for tens of billions of dollars. (Over at Bits, Nick Bilton wondered whether users should be in line to dip their beaks in.)

headline.main: Facebook Now Must Balance User Experience and Investor Experience
